abstract.p: Laurence Jacobs letter on June 22 article holds both volunteer and paid firefighters are professionals

block.p: ''A Firehouse Tradition Gives Way, Uneasily'' (news article, June 22) casts volunteer firefighters as the opposite of professionals. This is simply not the case. Whether they take a check home twice a month or never get paid for the countless hours of dedicated service, firefighters are all professionals.

''A Firehouse Tradition Gives Way, Uneasily'' (news article, June 22) casts volunteer firefighters as the opposite of professionals. This is simply not the case. Whether they take a check home twice a month or never get paid for the countless hours of dedicated service, firefighters are all professionals.
In my seven years as a volunteer firefighter, I have worked alongside some of the most dedicated and professional firefighters both paid and volunteer in Nassau County and in Montgomery County, Md.

It is true that firehouse membership across the county is low, and finding recruits can be difficult. Calling one group ''professional'' at the other's expense will only worsen this divide at a time when both groups need to be working together more closely and strengthening each other.
LAURENCE JACOBS Great Neck, N.Y., June 22, 2000
